knowledge and by doing that we were um hoping to switch out the technology

um over the over the years that we've served our customers uh and so we first

form um luckily for us uh we have we have a lot of employees that are around

tables Pages screens fields we wanted to describe the processes that we that our

um uh mixing the domain knowledge and the technology and that was something that

you look at uh in research for instance also you see and you you find if you are

of so that was the first um observation the first realization that we needed to
invest in the platform and the architecture as well
well the second problem of course is what kind of model are you going to use because this model should account for
all the variation that you have in your application and when we started out we were thinking that we could generate
every screen from this model and so we started out with three simple Concepts
we had entities and entities described stuff that you can find in the real world uh we're thinking about
organizations persons uh countries um Goods um all the stuff that's just
there and then we had processes of course because uh business is all about the processes invoicing uh handling

business runs and then the the third large ingredient were roles because the
entity play a role in such a process for the organization can play the role of
customer in your invoice but it can also uh play the role of supplier in your
invoice um and those were the three ingredients that we had but if you have
only these three ingredients uh the application that you will generate will serve as these three

that's fine and that's the reason why why we write better so farare because everything is the same and everything is
consistent but on the other hand if you want to generate a really cool looking
uix that's um uh specified for this kind of
process of course you need more information it's not enough to know that you have a process you need to know that

instances so that your uix can be better but all the details that you need of
course need to be expressed in your model so the goal or or the The Challenge in a low Code system is to
create a model that has information enough to generate a really good-look
application but it's not so detailed that you could easily handwritten it if
we have characteristics in the model that we only use in one uh situation we
kind of shooting the whole um model driven aspect of the
application so that's a really important observation um and the solution that we
took is that we've even in some sense made the part that we
would generate smaller so we decided okay we have a platform that we have handwritten we have a front end and a

end by hand this allows us to um prevent
the model from getting too much detail too much um one-offs as to say to

most important uh observation that we made during these years is that not everything needs to be loow Cod we don't

model there are Parts in the application that are so special um they are just
there but to give you an idea of of the uh the balance these are just the
specials we handwritten 5% of the application 95 is still generated is
still generated from this mod expressed by this model this is important because this

Engineers the the instances that need a really special uix
um those are written by our Engineers but all the standardized stuff is written by our citizen

jump from this abstraction into code is hard to make for people and this system

win so I started out with the goal that we had was to have some model that's
purely functional and then we can swap out the technology um and of course uh the
sounds like a really nice goal to have uh but it's not that simple of course
because you have invested in a in an architecture in a framework youve invested in a generator that write
generates specific code for your architecture and your framework but we actually managed to do
this uh while developing uh the whole system when we started out we had a
model and we generated Silverlight code back way back uh and we had a really
nice front end in silverite and then silverite was killed of course now during the development of the
system we were able to swap out the silver light and rewrite it into a JavaScript front end while the citizen
developers could still work on the model they didn't lose any productivity they didn't lose any speed in the development
they could just work on continuing uh what they were doing uh while we re-engineered the front
end now of course this sounds like I said really cheap uh but it involves a

suboptimal uh but worked for a small set of customers and we were able to
re-engineer those solutions to support larger sets of customers while keeping

refactoring into something uh nicer and by U changing that on one spot in the
generator we could just generate uh a new um implementation but we can even
generate two implementation next to each other and Benchmark them because the knowledge is not in the code but the
knowledge is into the model so there is no duplication when we have two solutions we can easily put them next to
each other uh without duplicating our information and that's a really powerful
tool to have when you want to experiment or when you want to uh prototype a new
implementation of course another big win that we uh saw during the years is how
